update.description:
* First iteration of gsoc plugins project. Attached plugins of models displayed in world tab.

* Created subtree with filename, innerxml, updated comments, added plugin to test and ModelToSDF() function.

* reverted msgs to standard PluginToSDF() function.

* updated changelog.

* changed innerxml test.

* first draft with plugin type error message.

* fill pluginMsg implemented. Response not receiving data.

* Add Property Box for Plugins. Change info to model_plugin

* Removed qDebug() code lines.

* update comments

* corrected Qt::Flags warning and integrated feedback from louise. std::mutex receiveMutex on my system not able to compile, pls check.

* fix build, add some doxygen, cleanup some spaces, simplify Model::OnRequest

* fix test

* Close branch attach_plugins_louise

* test for model plugins. still fails.

* added URI to test uniqueness of model plugins. Test still fails.

* tweaks to test and URI usage

* Close branch attach_plugins_louise

* sensor msg can not be serialized it seems.

* implemented sensor properties + uniqueness with uris. Added test, fails.
update.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties
update.reason: Make a new one with ignition transport services

content.raw:
It looks like the default branch in your repo has been compromised and there are some conflicts. You can try merging with the latest revision of osrf's default, which is the one on the top of [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/branch/default) page. At the moment, it would be:

`hg merge -r b0fb882`
content.html:
It looks like the default branch in your repo has been compromised and there are some conflicts. You can try merging with the latest revision of osrf's default, which is the one on the top of this page. At the moment, it would be:

hg merge -r b0fb882

pull_request.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
An update, we're working on an implementation for the backend which uses ign-transport services. At the moment, we have a couple of options:

1. Decline this PR and wait for it to come in an ignition form. That will take a bit to come because it depends on other pull requests. 

1. Accept this PR as it is, and refactor the backend later to use ignition. Most of the GUI stuff added in this PR, including the tests, won't change.
content.html:
An update, we're working on an implementation for the backend which uses ign-transport services. At the moment, we have a couple of options:

  1. Decline this PR and wait for it to come in an ignition form. That will take a bit to come because it depends on other pull requests.

  2. Accept this PR as it is, and refactor the backend later to use ignition. Most of the GUI stuff added in this PR, including the tests, won't change.
